content.description: Thin climbing down low, with multiple not-great hold options. After the first two bolts the route becomes easier and juggier. The bottom with probably get harder as feet get smoothed out.
content.protection: 6 bolts, and two-bolt anchor with chains
content.location: 3rd route left from the right-hand arete

content.description: Chimney up the smooth and often wet slab using the boulder behind you. After you get past the top of the boulder the arete comes into play and the feet get a little better.
content.location: As you walk under the amphitheater on your left, look towards a block at the right that forms a cave at the end of the amphitheater and duck in toward the back of the cave(about 5' tall). The climb starts on the slick slab at the back of the cave.

climbs.name: Lizard Wizard
climbs.fa: Lil Reggie, Clay Prasse, Aaron Brouwer (2018)

content.description:
This route climbs the "stunning arête" at the far right side of the wall. As the legend goes, one must harness the wizardry power of the one and only Lil Reggie to accomplish the direct start to this climb, unless your weakling body is more attracted to easier alternatives. Once established, ride parts of the arête to the top on excellent holds sculpted by Lil Reggie himself.

"Red River Gorge, you are welcome." - Lil Reggie
content.location: Currently the last route furthest right at the entire crag, climbs slightly left of and on the obvious arête.

content.description: A long move off a good undercling leads to sustained pocket climbing.  Get a quick shake and take on back to back pocket boulder problems.
Climb a funky technical boulder problem to relatively easy climbing then move left in to the last bolt of whole lotta nanners and finish on the same anchors.
content.location: Right of whole lotta nanners. Obvious nipple hold below the first bolt

content.description: Longest route at hole in the wall. Climb stacked boulder problems on pockets and crimps between good rests.
content.location: Tallest route on the wall. Starts on a right leaning flake feature right of hole new world.

content.description: Sustained crimps and pockets between decent rests. Decent warmup for this wall
Not you typical rrg vert crimp ladder. Neat moves, tricky sequences, and not many rests. Be sure to find the hidden jug when clipping the chains.
Sustained pocket climbing leads a great rest. Get it back then blast through big moves on pockets to a thank god anchor clipping hold.
content.location: Just right of Holé Molé; long chain draw on the fourth bolt.
